data.title: Burundi lifts capital controls
data.meta_description: Central bank permits bureaux de change to reopen and allows receipt and transfer of FX
data.text:
The central bank of Burundi is allowing foreign exchange bureaux to reopen, after having been closed for more than two and a half years.

The announcement, made on October 7, also permits Burundians to receive and transfer foreign currency.

The Bank of the Republic of Burundi (BRB) ordered the countryâ€™s stand-alone foreign exchange offices to close on February 10, 2020. The central bank charged that many bureaux were flouting a regulation capping their profits at 15%.
